G.T. 3251
SECRETS.
Operations.
From: General Delme Radcliffe, Italy.
To: C.I.G.S., War Office.
Handed in 1,50 a.m. 7.1.18.
Received 4.30 a.m.
10101. January 6th, evening.
3rd Army. Enemy artillery and m?rtars active on 23rd Corps front particularly between Fossalta and Paludello, day of January 5th.
4th Army. On 28th Corps front enemy artillery, active especially on Col del Orso Val Calcino and M. Rallone during day of January 5th.
1st Army. Moderate artillery activity. Enemy shelled 22nd and 20th Corps front especially Montagna Nuova Valstagna and San Nazario.
On 22nd Corps front patrol of Italians assault troops met and put to flight enemy patrols capturing two prisoners afternoon of January 5th.
3rd Corps. Nothing cf Importance.
Aerial activity. Considerable on army front; also on Asiago plateau. Italian Capronis bombed La Comina aerodrome. Though the machines were hampered by bad visibility, other bombing expeditions were carried out. Bombs dropped on Bolzano.
